meanings.definition: A varied mixture or assortment, especially of musical pieces.
meanings.sent1: The concert featured medleys of popular songs from different decades.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed listening to the medleys of classical music played by the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: At the music store, they accidentally created medleys of mismatched CDs.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a medley of melodies, each one playing at a different tempo.
meanings.sent5: The medleys of colors in the sunset painted the sky in a beautiful array.

meanings.definition: A varied mixture of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The market was bustling with medleys of shoppers from all walks of life.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a medley of flowers, each one blooming in its own unique way.
meanings.sent3: The classroom was a medley of students, each one bringing a different perspective.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city, the streets were a medley of sounds, blending into a chaotic symphony.
meanings.sent5: The medleys of flavors in the dish created a delightful explosion on her taste buds.
